   23: -module(ssh_protocol_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet.hrl").
   27: -include("ssh.hrl").		% ?UINT32, ?BYTE, #ssh{} ...
   28: -include("ssh_transport.hrl").
   29: -include("ssh_auth.hrl").
   30: -include("ssh_test_lib.hrl").
   31: 
   32: -export([
   33:          suite/0,
   34:          all/0,
   35:          groups/0,
   36:          init_per_suite/1,
   37:          end_per_suite/1,
   38:          init_per_testcase/2,
   39:          end_per_testcase/2
   40:         ]).
   41: 
   42: -export([
   43:          bad_long_service_name/1,
   44:          bad_packet_length/2,
   45:          bad_service_name/1,
   46:          bad_service_name/2,
   47:          bad_service_name_length/2,
   48:          bad_service_name_then_correct/1,
   49:          bad_very_long_service_name/1,
   50:          client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds/1,
   51:          client_handles_banner_keyboard_interactive/1,
   52:          client_info_line/1,
   53:          do_gex_client_init/3,
   54:          do_gex_client_init_old/3,
   55:          empty_service_name/1,
   56:          ext_info_c/1,
   57:          ext_info_s/1,
   58:          kex_strict_negotiated/1,
   59:          kex_strict_msg_ignore/1,
   60:          kex_strict_msg_unknown/1,
   61:          gex_client_init_option_groups/1,
   62:          gex_client_init_option_groups_file/1,
   63:          gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file/1,
   64:          gex_client_old_request_exact/1,
   65:          gex_client_old_request_noexact/1,
   66:          gex_server_gex_limit/1,
   67:          lib_match/1,
   68:          lib_no_match/1,
   69:          lib_works_as_client/1,
   70:          lib_works_as_server/1,
   71:          modify_append/1,
   72:          modify_combo/1,
   73:          modify_prepend/1,
   74:          modify_rm/1,
   75:          no_common_alg_client_disconnects/1,
   76:          no_common_alg_server_disconnects/1,
   77:          no_ext_info_s1/1,
   78:          no_ext_info_s2/1,
   79:          packet_length_too_large/1,
   80:          packet_length_too_short/1,
   81:          preferred_algorithms/1,
   82:          service_name_length_too_large/1,
   83:          service_name_length_too_short/1,
   84:          client_close_after_hello/1
   85:         ]).
   86: 
   87: -define(NEWLINE, <<"\r\n">>).
   88: -define(REKEY_DATA_TMO, 65000).
   89: 
   90: -define(DEFAULT_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group14-sha256').
   91: -define(EXTRA_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group1-sha1').
   92: 
   93: -define(CIPHERS, ['aes256-ctr','aes192-ctr','aes128-ctr','aes128-cbc','3des-cbc']).
   94: -define(DEFAULT_CIPHERS, (fun() -> Ciphs = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
   95:                                    [{client2server,Ciphs}, {server2client,Ciphs}]
   96:                           end)()
   97:         ).
   98: 
   99: 
  100: -define(v(Key, Config), proplists:get_value(Key, Config)).
  101: -define(v(Key, Config, Default), proplists:get_value(Key, Config, Default)).
  102: 
  103: 
  104: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  105: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  106: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  107: 
  108: suite() ->
  109:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  110:      {timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  111: 
  112: all() -> 
  113:     [{group,tool_tests},
  114:      client_info_line,
  115:      {group,kex},
  116:      {group,service_requests},
  117:      {group,authentication},
  118:      {group,packet_size_error},
  119:      {group,field_size_error},
  120:      {group,ext_info},
  121:      {group,preferred_algorithms},
  122:      {group,client_close_early}
  123:     ].
  124: 
  125: groups() ->
  126:     [{tool_tests, [], [lib_works_as_client,
  127: 		       lib_works_as_server,
  128: 		       lib_match,
  129: 		       lib_no_match
  130: 		      ]},
  131:      {packet_size_error, [], [packet_length_too_large,
  132: 			      packet_length_too_short]},
  133:       
  134:      {field_size_error, [], [service_name_length_too_large,
  135: 			     service_name_length_too_short]},
  136:       
  137:      {kex, [], [no_common_alg_server_disconnects,
  138: 		no_common_alg_client_disconnects,
  139: 		gex_client_init_option_groups,
  140: 		gex_server_gex_limit,
  141: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file,
  142: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_file,
  143: 		gex_client_old_request_exact,
  144: 		gex_client_old_request_noexact,
  145:                 kex_strict_negotiated,
  146:                 kex_strict_msg_ignore,
  147:                 kex_strict_msg_unknown]},
  148:      {service_requests, [], [bad_service_name,
  149: 			     bad_long_service_name,
  150: 			     bad_very_long_service_name,
  151: 			     empty_service_name,
  152: 			     bad_service_name_then_correct
  153: 			    ]},
  154:      {authentication, [], [client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds,
  155:                            client_handles_banner_keyboard_interactive
  156: 			  ]},
  157:      {ext_info, [], [no_ext_info_s1,
  158:                      no_ext_info_s2,
  159:                      ext_info_s,
  160:                      ext_info_c
  161:                     ]},
  162:      {preferred_algorithms, [], [preferred_algorithms,
  163:                                  modify_append,
  164:                                  modify_prepend,
  165:                                  modify_rm,
  166:                                  modify_combo
  167:                                 ]},
  168:      {client_close_early, [], [client_close_after_hello
  169:                                ]}
  170:     ].
  171: 
  172: 
  173: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  174:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(start_std_daemon( setup_dirs( start_apps(Config)))).
  175: 
  176: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  177:     stop_apps(Config).
  178: 
  179: init_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  180:     start_std_daemon(Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']},
  181:                                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  182:                                                     ]}]);
  183: init_per_testcase(kex_strict_negotiated, Config) ->
  184:     Config;
  185: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  186: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  187: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  188: 				   TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  189: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  190: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  191:     Opts = case TC of
  192: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups ->
  193: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, 
  194:                      [{1023, 5, 
  195:                        16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A770E2EC9F
  196:                       }]}];
  197: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_file ->
  198: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  199: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test"),
  200: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {file,F}}];
  201: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ->
  202: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  203: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test.moduli"),
  204: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {ssh_moduli_file,F}}];
  205: 	       _ when TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  206: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  207: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  208: 		    [{dh_gex_groups, 
  209:                       [{1023, 2, 16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A771225323},
  210:                        {1535, 5, 16#D1391174233D315398FE2830AC6B2B66BCCD01B0A634899F339B7879F1DB85712E9DC4E4B1C6C8355570C1D2DCB53493DF18175A9C53D1128B592B4C72D97136F5542FEB981CBFE8012FDD30361F288A42BD5EBB08BAB0A5640E1AC48763B2ABD1945FEE36B2D55E1D50A1C86CED9DD141C4E7BE2D32D9B562A0F8E2E927020E91F58B57EB9ACDDA106A59302D7E92AD5F6E851A45FA1CFE86029A0F727F65A8F475F33572E2FDAB6073F0C21B8B54C3823DB2EF068927E5D747498F96E1E827},
  211:                        {3071, 2, 16#DFAA35D35531E0F524F0099877A482D2AC8D589F374394A262A8E81A8A4FB2F65FADBAB395E05D147B29D486DFAA41F41597A256DA82A8B6F76401AED53D0253F956CEC610D417E42E3B287F7938FC24D8821B40BFA218A956EB7401BED6C96C68C7FD64F8170A8A76B953DD2F05420118F6B144D8FE48060A2BCB85056B478EDEF96DBC70427053ECD2958C074169E9550DD877779A3CF17C5AC850598C7586BEEA9DCFE9DD2A5FB62DF5F33EA7BC00CDA31B9D2DD721F979EA85B6E63F0C4E30BDDCD3A335522F9004C4ED50B15DC537F55324DD4FA119FB3F101467C6D7E1699DE4B3E3C478A8679B8EB3FA5C9B826B44530FD3BE9AD3063B240B0C853EBDDBD68DD940332D98F148D5D9E1DC977D60A0D23D0CA1198637FEAE4E7FAAC173AF2B84313A666CFB4EE6972811921D0AD867CE57F3BBC8D6CB057E3B66757BB46C9F72662624D44E14528327E3A7100E81A12C43C4E236118318CD90C8AA185BBB0C764826DAEAEE8DD245C5B451B4944E6122CC522D1C335C2EEF9429825A2B}
  212:                       ]},
  213:                      {dh_gex_limits, {1023,2000}}
  214: 		    ];
  215: 	       _ ->
  216: 		   []
  217: 	   end,
  218:     start_std_daemon(Config,
  219: 		     [{preferred_algorithms,[{cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  220:                                             ]}
  221: 		      | Opts]);
  222: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  223:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  224: 
  225: end_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  226:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  227: end_per_testcase(kex_strict_negotiated, Config) ->
  228:     Config;
  229: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  230: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  231: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  232: 				  TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  233: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  234: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  235:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  236: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  237:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  238: 
  239: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  240: %%% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  241: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  242: 
  243: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  244: %%% Connect to an erlang server and check that the testlib acts as a client.
  245: lib_works_as_client(Config) ->
  246:     %% Connect and negotiate keys
  247:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  248: 			  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]}]
  249: 			 ),
  250:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState),
  251: 
  252:     %% Do the authentcation
  253:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  254:     {ok,EndState} =
  255: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  256: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  257: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  258: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{user = User,
  259: 					    service = "ssh-connection",
  260: 					    method = "password",
  261: 					    data = <<?BOOLEAN(?FALSE),
  262: 						     ?STRING(unicode:characters_to_binary(Pwd))>>
  263: 					   }},
  264: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  265: 	  ], AfterKexState),
  266: 
  267:     %% Disconnect
  268:     {ok,_} =
  269: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  270: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_disconnect{code = ?SSH_DISCONNECT_BY_APPLICATION,
  271: 				      description = "End of the fun",
  272: 				      language = ""
  273: 				     }},
  274: 	   close_socket
  275: 	  ], EndState).
  276: 
  277: 
  278: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  279: %%% Connect an erlang client and check that the testlib can act as a server.
  280: lib_works_as_server(Config) ->
  281:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  282: 
  283:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  284:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  285:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  286: 
  287:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  288:     spawn_link(
  289:       fun() ->
  290: 	      {ok,_} =
  291: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  292: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  293: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  294: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  295: 		     receive_hello,
  296: 		     {send, hello},
  297: 
  298: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  299: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  300: 
  301: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  302: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  303: 
  304: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  305: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  306: 
  307: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  308: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  309: 
  310: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  311: 						       method="none",
  312: 						       user=User,
  313: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  314: 
  315: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "password",
  316: 						      partial_success = false}},
  317: 
  318: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  319: 						       method="password",
  320: 						       user=User,
  321: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  322: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  323: 		     close_socket,
  324: 		     print_state
  325: 		    ],
  326: 		    InitialState)
  327:       end),
  328: 
  329:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  330:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  331: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  332:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  333:                                                 ]}
  334:                          ]
  335: 			).
  336: 
  337: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  338: %%% Matching
  339: lib_match(_Config) ->
  340:     {ok,_} =
  341: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  342: 				{match, abc, abc},
  343: 				{match, '$a', {cde,fgh}},
  344: 				{match, {cde,fgh}, '$a'},
  345: 				{match, '_', {cde,fgh}},
  346: 				{match, [a,'$a',b], [a,{cde,fgh},b]},
  347: 				{match, [a,'$a'|'$b'], [a,{cde,fgh},b,c]},
  348: 				{match, '$b', [b,c]}
  349: 			       ]).
  350: 
  351: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  352: %%% Not matching
  353: lib_no_match(_Config) ->
  354:     case ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  355: 				 {match, '$x', b},
  356: 				 {match, a, '$x'}])
  357:     of
  358: 	{ok,_} -> {fail,"Unexpected match"};
  359: 	{error, {_Op,{expected,a,b},_State}} -> ok
  360:     end.
  361: 
  362: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  363: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  364: %%% being sent from the server.
  365: no_common_alg_server_disconnects(Config) ->
  366:     {ok,_} =
  367: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  368: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  369: 	   {connect,
  370: 	    server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
  371: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  372: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  373: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  374: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  375:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  376:                                    ]}
  377: 	    ]},
  378: 	   receive_hello,
  379: 	   {send, hello},
  380: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  381: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},  % with server unsupported 'ssh-dss' !
  382: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  383: 	  ]
  384: 	 ).
  385: 
  386: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  387: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  388: %%% being sent from the client.
  389: no_common_alg_client_disconnects(Config) ->
  390:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  391:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  392:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  393:     Parent = self(),
  394: 
  395:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  396:     Pid =
  397: 	spawn_link(
  398: 	  fun() ->
  399: 		  Parent !
  400: 		      {result,self(),
  401: 		       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  402: 			 [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  403: 			  {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  404: 				    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  405: 			  receive_hello,
  406: 			  {send, hello},
  407: 			  {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  408: 			  {send,  #ssh_msg_kexinit{ % with unsupported "SOME-UNSUPPORTED"
  409: 				     cookie = <<80,158,95,51,174,35,73,130,246,141,200,49,180,190,82,234>>,
  410: 				     kex_algorithms = [atom_to_list(?DEFAULT_KEX)],
  411: 				     server_host_key_algorithms = ["SOME-UNSUPPORTED"],  % SIC!
  412: 				     encryption_algorithms_client_to_server = ["aes128-ctr"],
  413: 				     encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = ["aes128-ctr"],
  414: 				     mac_algorithms_client_to_server = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  415: 				     mac_algorithms_server_to_client = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  416: 				     compression_algorithms_client_to_server = ["none"],
  417: 				     compression_algorithms_server_to_client = ["none"],
  418: 				     languages_client_to_server = [],
  419: 				     languages_server_to_client = [],
  420: 				     first_kex_packet_follows = false,
  421: 				     reserved = 0
  422: 				    }},
  423: 			  {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}
  424: 			 ],
  425: 			 InitialState)
  426: 		      }
  427: 	  end),
  428: 
  429:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  430:     %% which of course does not support SOME-UNSUPPORTED as pub key algo:
  431:     Result = std_connect(HostPort, Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  432:                                                                    {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  433:                                                                   ]}]),
  434:     ct:log("Result of connect is ~p",[Result]),
  435: 
  436:     receive
  437: 	{result,Pid,{ok,_}} -> 
  438: 	    ok;
  439: 	{result,Pid,{error,{Op,ExecResult,S}}} ->
  440: 	    ct:log("ERROR!~nOp = ~p~nExecResult = ~p~nState =~n~s",
  441: 		   [Op,ExecResult,ssh_trpt_test_lib:format_msg(S)]),
  442: 	    {fail, ExecResult};
  443: 	X -> 
  444: 	    ct:log("¤¤¤¤¤"),
  445: 	    ct:fail(X)
  446:     after 
  447: 	30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  448:     end.
  449: 
  450: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  451: gex_client_init_option_groups(Config) ->
  452:     do_gex_client_init(Config, {512, 2048, 4000},

  472: 
  473: do_gex_client_init(Config, {Min,N,Max}, {G,P}) ->
  474:     {ok,_} =
  475: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  476: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  477: 	   {connect,
  478: 	    server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
  479: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  480: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  481: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  482: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,['diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256']},
  483:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  484:                                    ]}
  485: 	    ]},
  486: 	   receive_hello,
  487: 	   {send, hello},
  488: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  489: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  490: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_request{min = Min, 
  491: 					      n = N,
  492: 					      max = Max}},
  493: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_group{p=P, g=G, _='_'},  receive_msg}
  494: 	  ]
  495: 	 ).
  496:

  501:                            ).

  506:                            ).

  515: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},

  517: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,['diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256']},
  518:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  519:                                    ]}
  520: 	    ]},
  521: 	   receive_hello,
  522: 	   {send, hello},

  525: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_request_old{n = N}},

  530: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  531: bad_service_name(Config) -> 
  532:     bad_service_name(Config, "kfglkjf").
  533:     
  534: bad_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  535:     bad_service_name(Config, 
  536: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE div 2, $a)).
  537: 
  538: bad_very_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  539:     bad_service_name(Config,
  540: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE+5, $a)).
  541: 
  542: empty_service_name(Config) ->
  543:     bad_service_name(Config, "").
  544:     
  545: bad_service_name_then_correct(Config) ->
  546:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  547:     {ok,_} =
  548: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  549: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  550: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "kdjglkfdjgkldfjglkdfjglkfdjglkj"}},
  551: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-connection"}},
  552: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  553: 	   ], InitialState).
  554: 
  555: 
  556: bad_service_name(Config, Name) ->
  557:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  558:     {ok,_} =
  559: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  560: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  561: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = Name}},
  562: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  563: 	  ], InitialState).
  564: 
  565: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  566: packet_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, +4).
  567: 
  568: packet_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, -4).
  569:     
  570: bad_packet_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  571:     PacketFun = 
  572: 	fun(Msg, Ssh) ->
  573: 		BinMsg = ssh_message:encode(Msg),
  574: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh, LengthExcess)
  575: 	end,
  576:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  577:     {ok,_} =
  578: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  579: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  580: 	   {send, {special,
  581: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"},
  582: 		   PacketFun}},
  583: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  584: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  585: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  586: 	  ], InitialState).
  587: 
  588: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  589: service_name_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, +4).
  590: 
  591: service_name_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, -4).
  592: 
  593: 
  594: bad_service_name_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  595:     PacketFun = 
  596: 	fun(#ssh_msg_service_request{name=Service}, Ssh) ->
  597: 		BinName = list_to_binary(Service),
  598: 		BinMsg = 
  599: 		    <<?BYTE(?SSH_MSG_SERVICE_REQUEST),
  600: 		      %% A bad string encoding of Service:
  601: 		      ?UINT32(size(BinName)+LengthExcess), BinName/binary
  602: 		    >>,
  603: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh)
  604: 	end,
  605:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  606:     {ok,_} =
  607: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  608: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  609: 	   {send, {special,
  610: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, 
  611: 		   PacketFun} },
  612: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  613: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  614: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  615: 	  ], InitialState).
  616:     
  617: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  618: %%% This is due to a fault report (OTP-13255) with OpenSSH-6.6.1
  619: client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds(Config) ->
  620:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  621: 
  622:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  623:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  624:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  625: 
  626:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  627:     spawn_link(
  628:       fun() ->
  629: 	      {ok,_} =
  630: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  631: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  632: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  633: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  634: 		     receive_hello,
  635: 		     {send, hello},
  636: 
  637: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  638: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  639: 
  640: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  641: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  642: 
  643: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  644: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  645: 
  646: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  647: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  648: 
  649: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  650: 						       method="none",
  651: 						       user=User,
  652: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  653: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "keyboard-interactive",
  654: 						      partial_success = false}},
  655: 		     
  656: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  657: 						       method="keyboard-interactive",
  658: 						       user=User,
  659: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  660: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  661: 							   instruction = "",
  662: 							   language_tag = "",
  663: 							   num_prompts = 1,
  664: 							   data = <<0,0,0,10,80,97,115,115,119,111,114,100,58,32,0>>
  665: 							  }},
  666: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 1,
  667: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  668: 		      
  669: 		     %% the next is strange, but openssh 6.6.1 does this and this is what this testcase is about
  670: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  671: 							   instruction = "",
  672: 							   language_tag = "",
  673: 							   num_prompts = 0,
  674: 							   data = <<>>
  675: 							  }},
  676: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 0,
  677: 							     data = <<>>,
  678: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  679: 		     %% Here we know that the tested fault is fixed
  680: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  681: 		     close_socket,
  682: 		     print_state
  683: 		    ],
  684: 		    InitialState)
  685:       end),
  686: 
  687:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  688:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  689: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  690:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  691:                                                 ]}]
  692: 			).
  693: 
  694: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  695: %%% SSH_MSG_USERAUTH_BANNER can be sent at any time during user auth.
  696: %%% The following test mimics a SSH server implementation that sends the banner
  697: %%% immediately before sending SSH_MSG_USERAUTH_SUCCESS.
  698: client_handles_banner_keyboard_interactive(Config) ->
  699:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  700: 
  701:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  702:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  703:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  704: 
  705:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  706:     spawn_link(
  707:       fun() ->
  708: 	      {ok,_} =
  709: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  710: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  711: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  712: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  713: 		     receive_hello,
  714: 		     {send, hello},
  715: 
  716: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  717: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  718: 
  719: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  720: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  721: 
  722: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  723: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  724: 
  725: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  726: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  727: 
  728: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  729: 						       method="none",
  730: 						       user=User,
  731: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  732: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "keyboard-interactive",
  733: 						      partial_success = false}},
  734: 
  735: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  736: 						       method="keyboard-interactive",
  737: 						       user=User,
  738: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  739: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  740: 							   instruction = "",
  741: 							   language_tag = "",
  742: 							   num_prompts = 1,
  743: 							   data = <<0,0,0,10,80,97,115,115,119,111,114,100,58,32,0>>
  744: 							  }},
  745: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 1,
  746: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  747: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  748: 							   instruction = "",
  749: 							   language_tag = "",
  750: 							   num_prompts = 0,
  751: 							   data = <<>>
  752: 							  }},
  753: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 0,
  754: 							     data = <<>>,
  755: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  756:                      {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_banner{message = "Banner\n"}},
  757: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  758: 		     close_socket,
  759: 		     print_state
  760: 		    ],
  761: 		    InitialState)
  762:       end),
  763: 
  764:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  765:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config,
  766: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  767:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  768:                                                 ]}]
  769: 			).
  770: 
  771: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  772: client_info_line(Config) ->
  773:     %% A client must not send an info-line. If it does, the server should handle
  774:     %% handle this gracefully
  775:     {ok,Pid} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:add_report_handler(),
  776:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  777:     {_, _, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir,DataDir}]),
  778: 
  779:     %% Fake client:
  780:     {ok,S} = gen_tcp:connect("localhost",Port,[]),
  781:     gen_tcp:send(S,"An illegal info-string\r\n"),
  782:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  783: 
  784:     %% wait for server to react:
  785:     timer:sleep(1000),
  786: 
  787:     %% check if a badmatch was received:
  788:     {ok, Reports} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:get_reports(Pid),
  789:     case lists:any(fun({error_report,_,{_,supervisor_report,L}}) when is_list(L) -> 
  790: 			   lists:member({reason,{badmatch,{error,closed}}}, L);
  791: 		      (_) ->
  792: 			   false
  793: 		   end, Reports) of
  794: 	true ->
  795: 	    ct:fail("Bad error report on info_line from client");
  796: 	false ->
  797: 	    ok
  798:     end.
  799: 	
  800: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  801: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  802: %%% the client does not tell the server to send it
  803: no_ext_info_s1(Config) ->
  804:     %% Start the daemon
  805:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  806:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  807:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{server,Server}|Config]),
  808:     {ok,_} = 
  809:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  810:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  811: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  812:           ], AfterKexState),
  813:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  814: 
  815: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  816: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  817: %%% the server is not configured to send it
  818: no_ext_info_s2(Config) ->    
  819:     %% Start the daemon
  820:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,false},
  821:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  822:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  823:                                           {server,Server}
  824:                                           | Config]),
  825:     {ok,_} =
  826:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  827:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  828: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  829:           ], AfterKexState),
  830:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  831: 
  832: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  833: %%% The server sends the extension
  834: ext_info_s(Config) ->    
  835:     %% Start the daemon
  836:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  837:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  838:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  839:                                           {server,Server}
  840:                                           | Config]),
  841:     {ok,_} =
  842:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  843:           [{match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  844:           ],
  845:           AfterKexState),
  846:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  847: 
  848: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  849: %%% The client sends the extension
  850: ext_info_c(Config) ->    
  851:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  852:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  853:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  854: 
  855:     Parent = self(),
  856:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  857:     Pid =
  858:         spawn_link(
  859:           fun() ->
  860:                   Result =
  861:                       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  862:                         [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  863:                          {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  864:                                    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  865:                                    {recv_ext_info, true}
  866:                                   ]},
  867:                          receive_hello,
  868:                          {send, hello},
  869:                          
  870:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  871:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  872:                          
  873:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  874:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  875: 
  876:                          {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  877:                          {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  878: 
  879:                          {match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  880: 
  881:                          close_socket,
  882:                          print_state
  883:                         ],
  884:                         InitialState),
  885:                   Parent ! {result,self(),Result}
  886:           end),
  887: 
  888:     %% connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  889:     %% (expect error due to the close_socket in daemon):
  890:     {error,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  891:                             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  892:                                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  893:                                                    ]},
  894:                              {tstflg, [{ext_info_client,true}]},
  895:                              {send_ext_info, true}
  896:                             ]
  897:                            ),
  898:     
  899:     %% Check that the daemon got expected result:
  900:     receive
  901:         {result, Pid, {ok,_}} -> ok;
  902:         {result, Pid, Error} -> ct:fail("Error: ~p",[Error])
  903:     end.
  904: 
  905: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  906: %%%
  907: kex_strict_negotiated(Config0) ->
  908:     {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  909:     Config = start_std_daemon(Config0, []),
  910:     {Server, Host, Port} = proplists:get_value(server, Config),
  911:     Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
  912:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
  913:     {ok, ConnRef} = std_connect({Host, Port}, Config, []),
  914:     {algorithms, _A} = ssh:connection_info(ConnRef, algorithms),
  915:     ssh:stop_daemon(Server),
  916:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
  917:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Events),
  918:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Events),
  919:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
  920:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  921:     ok.
  922: 
  923: %% Connect to an erlang server and inject unexpected SSH ignore
  924: kex_strict_msg_ignore(Config) ->
  925:     ct:log("START: ~p~n=================================", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  926:     ExpectedReason = "strict KEX violation: unexpected SSH_MSG_IGNORE",
  927:     TestMessages =
  928:         [{send, ssh_msg_ignore},
  929:          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  930:          {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}],
  931:     kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason).
  932: 
  933: %% Connect to an erlang server and inject unexpected non-SSH binary
  934: kex_strict_msg_unknown(Config) ->
  935:     ct:log("START: ~p~n=================================", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  936:     ExpectedReason = "Bad packet: Size",
  937:     TestMessages =
  938:         [{send, ssh_msg_unknown},
  939:          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  940:          {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}],
  941:     kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason).
  942: 
  943: kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason) ->
  944:     {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  945:     Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
  946:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
  947:     %% Connect and negotiate keys
  948:     {ok, InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  949: 			  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]}]
  950: 			 ),
  951:     {ok, _AfterKexState} =
  952:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  953:           [{connect,
  954:             server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
  955:             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  956:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  957:                                    ]},
  958:              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  959:              {recv_ext_info, false},
  960:              {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  961:              {user_interaction, false}
  962:             | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
  963:             ]},
  964:            receive_hello,
  965:            {send, hello},
  966:            {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  967:            {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  968:            {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init}] ++
  969:               TestMessages,
  970:           InitialState),
  971:     ct:sleep(100),
  972:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
  973:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  974:     ct:log("Events = ~p", [Events]),
  975:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Events),
  976:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Events),
  977:     true = ssh_test_lib:event_logged(server, Events, ExpectedReason),
  978:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
  979:     ok.
  980: 
  981: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  982: %%%
  983: preferred_algorithms(Config) ->
  984:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  985:     {error,{eoptions,{{preferred_algorithms,{kex,[some_unknown_algo]}},
  986:                       "Unsupported value(s) found"}}} =
  987:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  988:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX],
  989:                       Ciphers,
  990:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  991:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  992:                                               ]}
  993:                       ]).
  994: 
  995: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  996: %%%
  997: modify_append(Config) ->
  998:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  999:     {ok,_} =
 1000:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1001:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, ?EXTRA_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
 1002:                       Ciphers,
 1003:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1004:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1005:                                               ]},
 1006:                        {modify_algorithms, [{append,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
 1007:                       ]).
 1008: 
 1009: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1010: %%%
 1011: modify_prepend(Config) ->
 1012:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
 1013:     {ok,_} =
 1014:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1015:                       [?EXTRA_KEX, ?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
 1016:                       Ciphers,
 1017:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1018:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1019:                                               ]},
 1020:                        {modify_algorithms, [{prepend,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
 1021:                       ]).
 1022: 
 1023: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1024: %%%
 1025: modify_rm(Config) ->
 1026:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
 1027:     {ok,_} =
 1028:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1029:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
 1030:                       tl(Ciphers),
 1031:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
 1032:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1033:                                               ]},
 1034:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]},
 1035:                                                  {cipher,[hd(Ciphers)]}
 1036:                                                 ]}
 1037:                                            ]}
 1038:                       ]).
 1039: 
 1040: 
 1041: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1042: %%%
 1043: modify_combo(Config) ->
 1044:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
 1045:     LastC = lists:last(Ciphers),
 1046:     {ok,_} =
 1047:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1048:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
 1049:                       [LastC] ++ (tl(Ciphers)--[LastC]) ++ [hd(Ciphers)],
 1050:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
 1051:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1052:                                               ]},
 1053:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}
 1054:                                                 ]},
 1055:                                             {prepend,[{cipher,[{server2client,[LastC]}]}
 1056:                                                      ]},
 1057:                                             {append,[{cipher,[a,hd(Ciphers),b]}
 1058:                                                     ]}
 1059:                                            ]}
 1060:                       ]).
 1061: 
 1062: 
 1063: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1064: %%%
 1065: client_close_after_hello(Config0) ->
 1066:     MaxSessions = 20,
 1067:     SleepSec = 15,
 1068:     Config = start_std_daemon(Config0, [{parallel_login,true},
 1069:                                         {max_sessions,MaxSessions},
 1070:                                         {negotiation_timeout,SleepSec*1000}
 1071:                                        ]),
 1072: 
 1073:     {_Parents0, Conns0, []} = find_handshake_parent(server_port(Config)),
 1074: 
 1075:     Cs =
 1076:         [ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1077:            [{connect,
 1078:              server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
 1079:              [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1080:                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1081:                                     ]},
 1082:               {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1083:               {recv_ext_info, false},
 1084:               {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1085:               {user_interaction, false}
 1086:               | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1087:              ]},
 1088:             {send, hello}
 1089:            ]) || _ <- lists:seq(1,MaxSessions+100)],
 1090: 
 1091:     ct:log("=== Tried to start ~p sessions.", [length(Cs)]),
 1092: 
 1093:     ssh_info:print(fun ct:log/2),
 1094:     {Parents, Conns, Handshakers} = find_handshake_parent(server_port(Config)),
 1095:     ct:log("Found (Port=~p):~n"
 1096:            "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1097:            "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1098:            "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
 1099:            [server_port(Config),
 1100:             length(Conns), Conns,
 1101:             length(Handshakers), Handshakers,
 1102:             length(Parents), Parents]),
 1103:     if
 1104:         length(Handshakers)>0 ->
 1105:             lists:foreach(fun(P) -> exit(P,some_reason) end, Parents),
 1106:             ct:log("After sending exits; now going to sleep", []),
 1107:             timer:sleep((SleepSec+15)*1000),
 1108:             ct:log("After sleeping", []),
 1109:             ssh_info:print(fun ct:log/2),
 1110:             {Parents2, Conns2, Handshakers2} = find_handshake_parent(server_port(Config)),
 1111:             ct:log("Found (Port=~p):~n"
 1112:                    "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1113:                    "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1114:                    "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
 1115:                    [server_port(Config),
 1116:                     length(Conns2), Conns2,
 1117:                     length(Handshakers2), Handshakers2,
 1118:                     length(Parents2), Parents2]),
 1119:             if
 1120:                 Handshakers2==[] andalso Conns2==Conns0 ->
 1121:                     ok;
 1122:                 Handshakers2=/=[] ->
 1123:                     ct:log("Handshakers still alive: ~p", [Handshakers2]),
 1124:                     {fail, handshakers_alive};
 1125:                 true ->
 1126:                     ct:log("Connections before: ~p~n"
 1127:                            "Connections after: ~p", [Conns0,Conns2]),
 1128:                     {fail, connections_bad}
 1129:             end;
 1130: 
 1131:         true ->
 1132:             {fail, no_handshakers}
 1133:     end.
 1134: 
 1135: 
 1136: %%%================================================================
 1137: %%%==== Internal functions ========================================
 1138: %%%================================================================
 1139: 
 1140: chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1141:               ExpectedKex,
 1142:               ExpectedCiphers,
 1143:               ServerPrefOpts) ->
 1144:     %% Start the daemon
 1145:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(
 1146:                       [{send_ext_info,false},
 1147:                        {recv_ext_info,false},
 1148:                        {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}
 1149:                        | ServerPrefOpts])
 1150:     of
 1151:         {_,Host,Port} ->
 1152:             %% Check the Kex part
 1153:             ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1154:               [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
 1155:                {connect, Host, Port,
 1156:                 [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1157:                  {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1158:                  {user_interaction, false}
 1159:                 ]},
 1160:                {send, hello},
 1161:                receive_hello,
 1162:                {match,
 1163:                 #ssh_msg_kexinit{
 1164:                    kex_algorithms = to_lists(ExpectedKex),
 1165:                    encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = to_lists(ExpectedCiphers),
 1166:                    _   = '_'},
 1167:                 receive_msg}
 1168:               ]);
 1169:         Error ->
 1170:             Error
 1171:     end.
 1172: 
 1173: 
 1174: filter_supported(K, Algs) -> Algs -- (Algs--supported(K)).
 1175: 
 1176: supported(_K) -> proplists:get_value(
 1177:                    server2client,
 1178:                    ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(cipher)).
 1179: 
 1180: to_lists(L) -> lists:map(fun erlang:atom_to_list/1, L).
 1181:     
 1182: 
 1183: %%%---- init_suite and end_suite ---------------------------------------	
 1184: start_apps(Config) ->
 1185:     catch ssh:stop(),
 1186:     ok = ssh:start(),
 1187:     Config.
 1188: 
 1189: stop_apps(_Config) ->
 1190:     ssh:stop().
 1191: 
 1192: 
 1193: setup_dirs(Config) ->
 1194:     ct:log("Pub keys setup for: ~p",
 1195:            [ssh_test_lib:setup_all_user_host_keys(Config)]),
 1196:     Config.
 1197: 
 1198: system_dir(Config) -> filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system).
 1199: 
 1200: user_dir(Config) -> proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
 1201: 
 1202: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1203: start_std_daemon(Config) ->	
 1204:     start_std_daemon(Config, []).
 1205: 
 1206: start_std_daemon(Config, ExtraOpts) ->
 1207:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), 
 1208:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1209:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1210:     UserPasswords = [{"user1","pwd1"}],
 1211:     Options = [%%{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']}]}, %% For some test cases
 1212: 	       {system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
 1213: 	       {user_dir, UserDir},
 1214: 	       {user_passwords, UserPasswords},
 1215: 	       {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}
 1216: 	       | ExtraOpts],
 1217:     Ref = {Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon(Options),
 1218:     ct:log("Std server ~p started at ~p:~p~nOptions=~p",[Server, Host, Port, Options]),
 1219:     [{server,Ref}, {user_passwords, UserPasswords} | Config].
 1220: 
 1221: 
 1222: stop_std_daemon(Config) ->
 1223:     ssh:stop_daemon(server_pid(Config)),
 1224:     ct:log("Std server ~p at ~p:~p stopped", [server_pid(Config), server_host(Config), server_port(Config)]),
 1225:     lists:keydelete(server, 1, Config).
 1226: 
 1227: 
 1228: check_std_daemon_works(Config, Line) ->
 1229:     case std_connect(Config) of
 1230: 	{ok,C} ->
 1231: 	    ct:log("Server ~p:~p ~p is ok at line ~p",
 1232: 		   [server_host(Config), server_port(Config), 
 1233: 		    server_pid(Config), Line]),
 1234: 	    ok = ssh:close(C),
 1235: 	    Config;
 1236: 	Error = {error,_} ->
 1237: 	    ct:fail("Standard server ~p:~p ~p is ill at line ~p: ~p",
 1238: 		    [server_host(Config), server_port(Config), 
 1239: 		     server_pid(Config), Line, Error])
 1240:     end.
 1241: 
 1242: server_pid(Config)  -> element(1,?v(server,Config)).
 1243: server_host(Config) -> element(2,?v(server,Config)).
 1244: server_port(Config) -> element(3,?v(server,Config)).
 1245: 
 1246: server_user_password(Config) -> server_user_password(1, Config).
 1247: 
 1248: server_user_password(N, Config) -> lists:nth(N, ?v(user_passwords,Config)).
 1249:     
 1250: 
 1251: std_connect(Config) -> 
 1252:     std_connect({server_host(Config), server_port(Config)}, Config).
 1253:     
 1254: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config) ->
 1255:     std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, []).
 1256: 
 1257: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, Opts) ->
 1258:     std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts).
 1259: 
 1260: std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts) ->
 1261:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
 1262:     ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1263: 		%% Prefer User's Opts to the default opts
 1264: 		[O || O = {Tag,_} <- [{user,User},{password,Pwd},
 1265: 				      {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1266:                                       {save_accepted_host, false},
 1267: 				      {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1268: 				      {user_interaction, false}],
 1269: 		      not lists:keymember(Tag, 1, Opts)
 1270: 		] ++ Opts,
 1271: 		30000).
 1272:     
 1273: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------	
 1274: connect_and_kex(Config) ->
 1275:     connect_and_kex(Config, ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([]) ).
 1276: 
 1277: connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState) ->
 1278:     ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1279:       [{connect,
 1280: 	server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
 1281: 	[{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1282:                                 {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1283:                                ]},
 1284:          {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1285:          {recv_ext_info, false},
 1286: 	 {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1287: 	 {user_interaction, false}
 1288:          | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1289:         ]},
 1290:        receive_hello,
 1291:        {send, hello},
 1292:        {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
 1293:        {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1294:        {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init},
 1295:        {match,# ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1296:        {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
 1297:        {match, #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg}
 1298:       ],
 1299:       InitialState).
 1300: 
 1301: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1302: 
 1303: %%% For matching peer disconnection
 1304: disconnect() ->
 1305:     disconnect('_').
 1306: 
 1307: disconnect(Code) ->
 1308:     {'or',[#ssh_msg_disconnect{code = Code,
 1309: 			       _='_'},
 1310: 	   tcp_closed,
 1311: 	   {tcp_error,econnaborted}
 1312: 	  ]}.
 1313: 
 1314: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1315: find_handshake_parent(Port) ->
 1316:     Acc = {_Parents=[], _Connections=[], _Handshakers=[]},
 1317:     find_handshake_parent(supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup), Port, Acc).
 1318: 
 1319: 
 1320: find_handshake_parent([{{ssh_system_sup,{address,_,Port,_}},
 1321:                         Pid,supervisor, [ssh_system_sup]}|_],
 1322:                       Port, Acc) ->
 1323:     find_handshake_parent(supervisor:which_children(Pid), Port, Acc);
 1324: 
 1325: find_handshake_parent([{{ssh_acceptor_sup,{address,_,Port,_}},
 1326:                         PidS,supervisor,[ssh_acceptor_sup]}|T],
 1327:                        Port, {AccP,AccC,AccH}) ->
 1328:     ParentHandshakers =
 1329:         [{PidW,PidH} ||
 1330:             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,{address,_,Port1,_}}, PidW, worker,
 1331:              [ssh_acceptor]} <- supervisor:which_children(PidS),
 1332:             Port1 == Port,
 1333:             PidH <- element(2, process_info(PidW,links)),
 1334:             is_pid(PidH),
 1335:             process_info(PidH,current_function) ==
 1336:                 {current_function,
 1337:                  {ssh_connection_handler,handshake,4}}],
 1338:     {Parents,Handshakers} = lists:unzip(ParentHandshakers),
 1339:     find_handshake_parent(T, Port, {AccP++Parents, AccC, AccH++Handshakers});
 1340: 
 1341: find_handshake_parent([{_Ref,PidS,supervisor,[ssh_connection_sup]}|T],
 1342:                       Port, {AccP,AccC,AccH}) ->
 1343:     Connections =
 1344:         [Pid ||
 1345:             {connection,Pid,worker,[ssh_connection_handler]} <-
 1346:                 supervisor:which_children(PidS)],
 1347:     find_handshake_parent(T, Port, {AccP, AccC++Connections, AccH});
 1348: 
 1349: find_handshake_parent([_|T], Port, Acc) ->
 1350:     find_handshake_parent(T, Port, Acc);
 1351: 
 1352: find_handshake_parent(_, _,  {AccP,AccC,AccH}) ->
 1353:     {lists:usort(AccP), lists:usort(AccC), lists:usort(AccH)}.
